body:
I have a script that's a variation on something @eschnett posted to the mailing list a while back.

It starts off like so (and goes on to install a bunch of things):

```
# Compiler
spack install gcc@5.4.0

# This might not do what you want if there's already
# a 5.4.0 on the system....
# Now all of the things will be built with %gcc@5.4.0
spack compiler add --scope site $(spack location -i gcc@5.4.0)

# R things
spack install R@3.3.1
spack install r-devtools@1.11.1
spack install r-shiny@0.13.2
spack install r-xml@3.98-1

# python things
spack install python@2.7.12
spack install py-flake8@3.0.4
# what other packages to we want to install?
```

I got everything to install, fixing failures along the way, then did a `spack uninstall -a` and removed "my" compiler from etc/spack/compilers.yaml.

I ran the script again, it built gcc and was building R prerequisites when it did this:

```
[...]
==> libxdmcp is already installed in /rss/spack-20161204/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/libxdmcp-1.1.2-re4fnifnbn3e5zozapczsykq2mukuupa
==> pkg-config is already installed in /rss/spack-20161204/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/pkg-config-0.29.1-ld3i7xv7jtacp7nt7k3aimjleiiuhpdg
==> python is already installed in /rss/spack-20161204/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/python-2.7.12-o6wssu2gjvn7j7ahz4qxwpxghzdp7qas
    **kwargs
  File "/rss/spack-20161204/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1203, in do_install
    **kwargs
  File "/rss/spack-20161204/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1203, in do_install
    **kwargs
  File "/rss/spack-20161204/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1175, in do_install
    rec = spack.store.db.get_record(self.spec)
  File "/rss/spack-20161204/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 81, in converter
    return function(self, spec_like, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/rss/spack-20161204/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 554, in get_record
    key = self._get_matching_spec_key(spec, **kwargs)
  File "/rss/spack-20161204/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 549, in _get_matching_spec_key
    raise KeyError("No such spec in database! %s" % spec)
KeyError: 'No such spec in database! python@2.7.12%gcc@5.4.0~tk~ucs4 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^bzip2@1.0.6%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^ncurses@6.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^openssl@1.0.2j%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^readline@6.3%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^sqlite@3.8.5%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@5.4.0+pic arch=linux-centos7-x86_64'
```

I'm not sure what to make of it.

I can keep it around for a bit and poke it with a stick if folks have questions.
title: Install, uninstall, reinstall dies
